We are excited to announce that starting tomorrow, Friday, September 11th, the Water Valley School District will be providing FREE meals to ALL children, 18 years old and younger. This applies to students who are in school, distance learners and children in the community.

We will have meals available for pick up from Water Valley High School daily from 11:30 A.M.-12:30 P.M. If you wish to pick up a meal for your child(ren), please pull to the side door of the cafeteria and the meal will be brought to your car.

Children not enrolled in WVSD must be present in the vehicle to pick up their meals.

USDA is offering free meals until December 31, 2020.

If you have uploaded funds to your student's account, please do not add any more funds at this time. Any money currently in your child's account can be used to buy extra meal items or the money will remain in their account to be used during the spring semester.

2020 Census
Water Valley School District community members, please complete the 2020 Census. It is very important as it affects all federal funding. Also, please share this post publicly to encourage others to participate.
As of April 21, almost half of Mississippi households have self-respond to the 2020 Census. 56.7% of Mississippi households have responded, below the national average of 61.6%. While the self-response rate is increasing, the growth rate is slow, and Mississippi is falling behind other states in response rates. Please encourage census participation in your local community. Participation has a direct impact on congressional representation and federal funding available to support students within Mississippi schools. Families can complete the census online at https://my2020census.gov/.

Ginger Sain, a teacher from Davidson Elementary School had the privilege to be chosen for her favorite author, Karen Kingsbury's Teacher Street Team. This team is a group of teachers from around the nation that helps to promote Karen's children's books. As a part of the team, Mrs. Sain received free copies of both Best Family Ever and Finding Home, which were donated to the school library. Prior to Spring Break, Mrs. Sain began reading these books to some of our 2nd, 3rd and 4th graders and encouraged them to participate in a coloring contest. Even though none of our students won the coloring contest, our 2nd, 3rd and 4th graders were chosen as runners up. As Runners Up, we received a letter from the authors, Karen Kingsbury and her son, Tyler Russell, bookmarks, Best Family Ever bracelets, and 11 autographed copies of Finding Home.

In February 2019, Mrs. Sain had the opportunity to meet the authors, Karen Kingsbury and her son, Tyler Russell.

Water Valley School District community members, please complete the 2020 Census. It is very important as it affects all federal funding. Also, please share this post publicly to encourage others to participate.

While the self-response rate is increasing, the growth rate is slow, and Mississippi is falling behind other states in response rates. Please encourage census participation in your local community. Participation has a direct impact on congressional representation and federal funding available to support students within Mississippi schools. Families can complete the census online at https://my2020census.gov/.

The Class of 2020 STAR Student for Water Valley High School is Lillian Lindsey. In order to receive this honor, the student must have an ACT score of 25 or higher and an overall cumulative GPA of 93. Lillian scored a 30 on the ACT.

Lillian is the daughter of Steve and Keli Lindsey and will enter the University of Mississippi in the fall. She has been accepted into the Sally McDonnell Barksdale Honors College and will major in Integrated Marketing Communications.

The STAR Student is asked to name a STAR Teacher. The teacher should be one of the student’s former elementary or secondary classroom teachers (current, former or retired). The teacher selected, in the STAR Student’s opinion, had the greatest contribution to their academic achievement. Lillian chose Angie Hodge, who was her Accelerated Algebra 2 teacher, as her STAR Teacher.

Water Valley School District is extremely proud of Lillian and her accomplishments.
